comments.body: nit: The test doesn't cover `prefixBytes` method.  I'm not a proponent of 100% test coverage always, but IMHO that method is a main factor in the "other->this" join so it should have coverage in this case.
nit: define "fkTopic" and "pkTopic" as class private fields?

I could... but I'd rather not, if that's ok. These strings are only dummy values, and they appear only once in the test, so there's no safety/consistency savings by declaring a field. There's no reason all the tests _need_ the same strings here, so a field actually creates indirection and coupling where it doesn't provide any value. And the name of the variable would be about as long as the string itself.

I get the impression this won't bother you either way, but it seemed rude not to respond, if I wasn't going to take the suggestion.
